trans-unit.source: Run a Hadoop job using DocumentDB and HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Run a Hadoop job using DocumentDB and HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to run a simple Hive, Pig, and MapReduce job with DocumentDB and Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to run a simple Hive, Pig, and MapReduce job with DocumentDB and Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Run a Hadoop job using DocumentDB and HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Run a Hadoop job using DocumentDB and HDInsight

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to run [Apache Hive][apache-hive], [Apache Pig][apache-pig], and [Apache Hadoop][apache-hadoop] MapReduce jobs on Azure HDInsight with DocumentDB's Hadoop connector.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to run [Apache Hive][apache-hive], [Apache Pig][apache-pig], and [Apache Hadoop][apache-hadoop] MapReduce jobs on Azure HDInsight with DocumentDB's Hadoop connector.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB's Hadoop connector allows DocumentDB to act as both a source and sink for Hive, Pig, and MapReduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB's Hadoop connector allows DocumentDB to act as both a source and sink for Hive, Pig, and MapReduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will use DocumentDB as both the data source and destination for Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will use DocumentDB as both the data source and destination for Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: How do I load data from DocumentDB using a Hive, Pig, or MapReduce job?
trans-unit.target: How do I load data from DocumentDB using a Hive, Pig, or MapReduce job?

trans-unit.source: How do I store data in DocumentDB using a Hive, Pig, or MapReduce job?
trans-unit.target: How do I store data in DocumentDB using a Hive, Pig, or MapReduce job?

trans-unit.source: We recommend getting started by watching the following video, where we run through a Hive job using DocumentDB and HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: We recommend getting started by watching the following video, where we run through a Hive job using DocumentDB and HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Then, return to this article, where you'll receive the full details on how you can run analytics jobs on your DocumentDB data.
trans-unit.target: Then, return to this article, where you'll receive the full details on how you can run analytics jobs on your DocumentDB data.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] This tutorial assumes that you have prior experience using Apache Hadoop, Hive, and/or Pig.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] This tutorial assumes that you have prior experience using Apache Hadoop, Hive, and/or Pig.

trans-unit.source: If you are new to Apache Hadoop, Hive, and Pig, we recommend visiting the [Apache Hadoop documentation][apache-hadoop-doc].
trans-unit.target: If you are new to Apache Hadoop, Hive, and Pig, we recommend visiting the [Apache Hadoop documentation][apache-hadoop-doc].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial also assumes that you have prior experience with DocumentDB and have a DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial also assumes that you have prior experience with DocumentDB and have a DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: If you are new to DocumentDB or you do not have a DocumentDB account, please check out our [Getting Started][getting-started] page.
trans-unit.target: If you are new to DocumentDB or you do not have a DocumentDB account, please check out our [Getting Started][getting-started] page.

trans-unit.source: Don't have time to complete the tutorial and just want to get the full sample PowerShell scripts for Hive, Pig, and MapReduce?
trans-unit.target: Don't have time to complete the tutorial and just want to get the full sample PowerShell scripts for Hive, Pig, and MapReduce?

trans-unit.source: Not a problem, get them [here][documentdb-hdinsight-samples].
trans-unit.target: Not a problem, get them [here][documentdb-hdinsight-samples].

trans-unit.source: The download also contains the hql, pig, and java files for these samples.
trans-unit.target: The download also contains the hql, pig, and java files for these samples.

trans-unit.source: Newest Version
trans-unit.target: Newest Version

trans-unit.source: Hadoop Connector Version
trans-unit.target: Hadoop Connector Version

trans-unit.source: Script Uri
trans-unit.target: Script Uri

trans-unit.source: https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/scriptaction/documentdb-hadoop-installer-v03.ps1
trans-unit.target: https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/scriptaction/documentdb-hadoop-installer-v03.ps1

trans-unit.source: Date Modified
trans-unit.target: Date Modified

trans-unit.source: Supported HDInsight Versions
trans-unit.target: Supported HDInsight Versions

trans-unit.source: Change Log
trans-unit.target: Change Log

trans-unit.source: Updated DocumentDB Java SDK to 1.1.0
trans-unit.target: Updated DocumentDB Java SDK to 1.1.0

trans-unit.source: Fixed connector's compatability with the <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=40886">Microsoft Hive ODBC driver
trans-unit.target: Fixed connector's compatability with the <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=40886">Microsoft Hive ODBC driver

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before following the instructions in this tutorial, ensure that you have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before following the instructions in this tutorial, ensure that you have the following:

trans-unit.source: A DocumentDB account, a database, and a collection with documents inside.
trans-unit.target: A DocumentDB account, a database, and a collection with documents inside.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Getting Started with DocumentDB][getting-started].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Getting Started with DocumentDB][getting-started].

trans-unit.source: Import sample data into your DocumentDB account with the [DocumentDB import tool][documentdb-import-data].
trans-unit.target: Import sample data into your DocumentDB account with the [DocumentDB import tool][documentdb-import-data].

trans-unit.source: Throughput.
trans-unit.target: Throughput.

trans-unit.source: Reads and writes from HDInsight will be counted towards your allotted request units for your collections.
trans-unit.target: Reads and writes from HDInsight will be counted towards your allotted request units for your collections.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Provisioned throughput, request units, and database operations][documentdb-manage-throughput].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Provisioned throughput, request units, and database operations][documentdb-manage-throughput].

trans-unit.source: Capacity for an additional stored procedure within each output collection.
trans-unit.target: Capacity for an additional stored procedure within each output collection.

trans-unit.source: The stored procedures are used for transferring resulting documents.
trans-unit.target: The stored procedures are used for transferring resulting documents.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Collections and provisioned throughput][documentdb-manage-document-storage].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Collections and provisioned throughput][documentdb-manage-document-storage].

trans-unit.source: Capacity for the resulting documents from the Hive, Pig, or MapReduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: Capacity for the resulting documents from the Hive, Pig, or MapReduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Manage DocumentDB capacity and performance][documentdb-manage-collections].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Manage DocumentDB capacity and performance][documentdb-manage-collections].

trans-unit.source: [*Optional*] Capacity for an additional collection.
trans-unit.target: [*Optional*] Capacity for an additional collection.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Provisioned document storage and index overhead][documentdb-manage-document-storage].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Provisioned document storage and index overhead][documentdb-manage-document-storage].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] In order to avoid the creation of a new collection during any of the jobs, you can either print the results to stdout, save the output to your WASB container, or specify an already existing collection.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] In order to avoid the creation of a new collection during any of the jobs, you can either print the results to stdout, save the output to your WASB container, or specify an already existing collection.

trans-unit.source: In the case of specifying an existing collection, new documents will be created inside the collection and already existing documents will only be affected if there is a conflict in *ids*.
trans-unit.target: In the case of specifying an existing collection, new documents will be created inside the collection and already existing documents will only be affected if there is a conflict in *ids*.

trans-unit.source: **The connector will automatically overwrite existing documents with id conflicts**.
trans-unit.target: **The connector will automatically overwrite existing documents with id conflicts**.

trans-unit.source: You can turn off this feature by setting the upsert option to false.
trans-unit.target: You can turn off this feature by setting the upsert option to false.

trans-unit.source: If upsert is false and a conflict occurs, the Hadoop job will fail; reporting an id conflict error.
trans-unit.target: If upsert is false and a conflict occurs, the Hadoop job will fail; reporting an id conflict error.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you **already** have an Azure Storage Account and you are willing to create a new blob container within that Account, you can skip to [Step 2: Create a customized HDInsight cluster](#ProvisionHDInsight).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you **already** have an Azure Storage Account and you are willing to create a new blob container within that Account, you can skip to [Step 2: Create a customized HDInsight cluster](#ProvisionHDInsight).

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob Storage for storing data.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight uses Azure Blob Storage for storing data.

trans-unit.source: It is called *WASB* or *Azure Storage - Blob*.
trans-unit.target: It is called *WASB* or *Azure Storage - Blob*.

trans-unit.source: WASB is Microsoft's implementation of HDFS on Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: WASB is Microsoft's implementation of HDFS on Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].

trans-unit.source: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, you specify an Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, you specify an Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: A specific Blob storage container from that account is designated as the default file system, just like in HDFS.
trans-unit.target: A specific Blob storage container from that account is designated as the default file system, just like in HDFS.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight cluster is by default provisioned in the same data center as the storage account you specify.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight cluster is by default provisioned in the same data center as the storage account you specify.

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Sign into the [Azure management portal][azure-classic-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign into the [Azure management portal][azure-classic-portal].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure HDInsight is currently supported in the Azure management portal, while Azure DocumentDB only exists in the Microsoft Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure HDInsight is currently supported in the Azure management portal, while Azure DocumentDB only exists in the Microsoft Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **+ NEW** on the lower left corner, point to **DATA SERVICES**, point to **STORAGE**, and then click **QUICK CREATE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **+ NEW** on the lower left corner, point to **DATA SERVICES**, point to **STORAGE**, and then click **QUICK CREATE**.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal where you can use Quick Create to set up a new storage account.][image-storageaccount-quickcreate]
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal where you can use Quick Create to set up a new storage account.][image-storageaccount-quickcreate]

trans-unit.source: Enter the **URL**, select the **LOCATION** and **REPLICATION** values, and then click **CREATE STORAGE ACCOUNT**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **URL**, select the **LOCATION** and **REPLICATION** values, and then click **CREATE STORAGE ACCOUNT**.

trans-unit.source: Affinity groups are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Affinity groups are not supported.

trans-unit.source: You will see the new storage account in the storage list.
trans-unit.target: You will see the new storage account in the storage list.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For best performance, make sure your storage account, HDInsight cluster, and DocumentDB account are located in the same Azure region.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For best performance, make sure your storage account, HDInsight cluster, and DocumentDB account are located in the same Azure region.

trans-unit.source: Azure regions that support all three services are: **East Asia**, **Southeast Asia**, **North Europe**, **West Europe**, **East US**, and **West US**.
trans-unit.target: Azure regions that support all three services are: **East Asia**, **Southeast Asia**, **North Europe**, **West Europe**, **East US**, and **West US**.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the **STATUS** of the new storage account is changed to **Online**.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the **STATUS** of the new storage account is changed to **Online**.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a customized HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a customized HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses Script Action from the Azure management portal to customize your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses Script Action from the Azure management portal to customize your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial we will use the Azure management portal to create your customized cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial we will use the Azure management portal to create your customized cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to use PowerShell cmdlets or the HDInsight .NET SDK, check out the [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action][hdinsight-custom-provision] article.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to use PowerShell cmdlets or the HDInsight .NET SDK, check out the [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action][hdinsight-custom-provision] article.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure management portal][azure-classic-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure management portal][azure-classic-portal].

trans-unit.source: You may be already signed in from the previous step.
trans-unit.target: You may be already signed in from the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Click **+ NEW** on the bottom of the page, click **DATA SERVICES**, click **HDINSIGHT**, and then click **CUSTOM CREATE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **+ NEW** on the bottom of the page, click **DATA SERVICES**, click **HDINSIGHT**, and then click **CUSTOM CREATE**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Cluster Details** page, type or choose the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Cluster Details** page, type or choose the following values:

trans-unit.source: Provide Hadoop HDInsight initial cluster details
trans-unit.target: Provide Hadoop HDInsight initial cluster details

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Cluster name
trans-unit.target: Cluster name

trans-unit.source: Name the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Name the cluster.

trans-unit.source: DNS name must start and end with an alpha numeric character, and may contain dashes.
trans-unit.target: DNS name must start and end with an alpha numeric character, and may contain dashes.

trans-unit.source: The field must be a string between 3 and 63 characters.
trans-unit.target: The field must be a string between 3 and 63 characters.

trans-unit.source: Subscription Name
trans-unit.target: Subscription Name

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one Azure Subscription, select the subscription corresponding to the storage account from Step 1.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one Azure Subscription, select the subscription corresponding to the storage account from Step 1.

trans-unit.source: Cluster Type
trans-unit.target: Cluster Type

trans-unit.source: For cluster type, select Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: For cluster type, select Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Operating System
trans-unit.target: Operating System

trans-unit.source: For operating system, select Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.
trans-unit.target: For operating system, select Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight version
trans-unit.target: HDInsight version

trans-unit.source: Choose the version.
trans-unit.target: Choose the version.

trans-unit.source: Select HDInsight version 3.1.
trans-unit.target: Select HDInsight version 3.1.

trans-unit.source: Enter or select the values as shown in the table and then click the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: Enter or select the values as shown in the table and then click the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Cluster** page, enter or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Cluster** page, enter or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Data nodes
trans-unit.target: Data nodes

trans-unit.source: Number of data nodes you want to deploy.
trans-unit.target: Number of data nodes you want to deploy.

trans-unit.source: Take note that HDInsight's data nodes are associated with both performance and pricing.
trans-unit.target: Take note that HDInsight's data nodes are associated with both performance and pricing.

trans-unit.source: Region/Virtual network
trans-unit.target: Region/Virtual network

trans-unit.source: Choose the same region as your newly created Storage account and your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Choose the same region as your newly created Storage account and your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight requires the storage account be located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight requires the storage account be located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: Later in the configuration, you can only choose a storage account that is in the same region as you specified here.
trans-unit.target: Later in the configuration, you can only choose a storage account that is in the same region as you specified here.

trans-unit.source: Click the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Cluster User** page, provide the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Cluster User** page, provide the following values:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: User name
trans-unit.target: User name

trans-unit.source: Specify the HDInsight cluster user name.
trans-unit.target: Specify the HDInsight cluster user name.

trans-unit.source: Password/Confirm Password
trans-unit.target: Password/Confirm Password

trans-unit.source: Specify the HDInsight cluster user password.
trans-unit.target: Specify the HDInsight cluster user password.

trans-unit.source: Click the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: On the **Storage Account** page, provide the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the **Storage Account** page, provide the following values:

trans-unit.source: Provide storage account for Hadoop HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Provide storage account for Hadoop HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Storage Account

trans-unit.source: Specify the Azure storage account that will be used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Azure storage account that will be used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can choose one of the three options: Use Existing Storage, Create New Storage, or Use Storage from Another Subscription
trans-unit.target: You can choose one of the three options: Use Existing Storage, Create New Storage, or Use Storage from Another Subscription

trans-unit.source: Please select Use Existing Storage.
trans-unit.target: Please select Use Existing Storage.

trans-unit.source: Account Name
trans-unit.target: Account Name

trans-unit.source: For Account name, select the account created in Step 1.
trans-unit.target: For Account name, select the account created in Step 1.

trans-unit.source: The drop-down only lists the storage accounts under the same Azure subscription that are located in the same data center where you chose to provision the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The drop-down only lists the storage accounts under the same Azure subscription that are located in the same data center where you chose to provision the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Default container
trans-unit.target: Default container

trans-unit.source: Specifies the default container on the storage account that is used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the default container on the storage account that is used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you choose Use Existing Storage for the Storage Account field, and there are no existing containers in that account, the container is created by default with the same name as the cluster name.
trans-unit.target: If you choose Use Existing Storage for the Storage Account field, and there are no existing containers in that account, the container is created by default with the same name as the cluster name.

trans-unit.source: If a container with the name of the cluster already exists, a sequence number will be appended to the container name.
trans-unit.target: If a container with the name of the cluster already exists, a sequence number will be appended to the container name.

trans-unit.source: Additional Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: Additional Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: HDInsight supports multiple storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight supports multiple storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: There is no limit on the additional storage accounts that can be used by a cluster.
trans-unit.target: There is no limit on the additional storage accounts that can be used by a cluster.

trans-unit.source: However, if you create a cluster using the Azure portal, you have a limit of seven due to the UI constraints.
trans-unit.target: However, if you create a cluster using the Azure portal, you have a limit of seven due to the UI constraints.

trans-unit.source: Each additional storage account you specify adds an extra Storage Account page to the wizard where you can specify the account information.
trans-unit.target: Each additional storage account you specify adds an extra Storage Account page to the wizard where you can specify the account information.

trans-unit.source: Click the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: On the **Script Actions** page, click **add script action** to provide details about PowerShell script that you will run to customize your cluster, as the cluster is being created.
trans-unit.target: On the **Script Actions** page, click **add script action** to provide details about PowerShell script that you will run to customize your cluster, as the cluster is being created.

trans-unit.source: The PowerShell script will install the DocumentDB Hadoop Connector onto your HDInsight clusters during cluster creation.
trans-unit.target: The PowerShell script will install the DocumentDB Hadoop Connector onto your HDInsight clusters during cluster creation.

trans-unit.source: Configure Script Action to customize an HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Configure Script Action to customize an HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the script action.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the script action.

trans-unit.source: Script URI
trans-unit.target: Script URI

trans-unit.source: Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Specify the URI to the script that is invoked to customize the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Please enter:
trans-unit.target: Please enter:

trans-unit.source: https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/scriptaction/documentdb-hadoop-installer-v03.ps1.
trans-unit.target: https://portalcontent.blob.core.windows.net/scriptaction/documentdb-hadoop-installer-v03.ps1.

trans-unit.source: Node Type
trans-unit.target: Node Type

trans-unit.source: Specifies the nodes on which the customization script is run.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the nodes on which the customization script is run.

trans-unit.source: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Worker nodes only.
trans-unit.target: You can choose All Nodes, Head nodes only, or Worker nodes only.

trans-unit.source: Please select All Nodes.
trans-unit.target: Please select All Nodes.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.
trans-unit.target: Specify the parameters, if required by the script.

trans-unit.source: No Parameters needed.
trans-unit.target: No Parameters needed.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to complete the cluster creation.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to complete the cluster creation.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Install and configure Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Install and configure Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Install Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Install Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Instructions can be found [here][powershell-install-configure].
trans-unit.target: Instructions can be found [here][powershell-install-configure].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Alternatively, just for Hive queries, you can use HDInsight's online Hive Editor.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Alternatively, just for Hive queries, you can use HDInsight's online Hive Editor.

trans-unit.source: To do so, sign in to the [Azure management portal][azure-classic-portal], click **HDInsight** on the left pane to view a list of your HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: To do so, sign in to the [Azure management portal][azure-classic-portal], click **HDInsight** on the left pane to view a list of your HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Click the cluster you want to run Hive queries on, and then click **Query Console**.
trans-unit.target: Click the cluster you want to run Hive queries on, and then click **Query Console**.

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment:
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment:

trans-unit.source: On a computer running Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012 or higher, you can use the built-in Search.
trans-unit.target: On a computer running Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012 or higher, you can use the built-in Search.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, type **powershell ise** and click **Enter**.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, type **powershell ise** and click **Enter**.

trans-unit.source: On a computer running a version earlier than Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012, use the Start menu.
trans-unit.target: On a computer running a version earlier than Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012, use the Start menu.

trans-unit.source: From the Start menu, type **Command Prompt** in the search box, then in the list of results, click **Command Prompt**.
trans-unit.target: From the Start menu, type **Command Prompt** in the search box, then in the list of results, click **Command Prompt**.

trans-unit.source: In the Command Prompt, type **powershell_ise** and click **Enter**.
trans-unit.target: In the Command Prompt, type **powershell_ise** and click **Enter**.

trans-unit.source: Add your Azure Account.
trans-unit.target: Add your Azure Account.

trans-unit.source: In the Console Pane, type **Add-AzureAccount** and click **Enter**.
trans-unit.target: In the Console Pane, type **Add-AzureAccount** and click **Enter**.

trans-unit.source: Type in the email address associated with your Azure subscription and click **Continue**.
trans-unit.target: Type in the email address associated with your Azure subscription and click **Continue**.

trans-unit.source: Type in the password for your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Type in the password for your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Click **Sign in**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Sign in**.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram identifies the important parts of your Azure PowerShell Scripting Environment.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram identifies the important parts of your Azure PowerShell Scripting Environment.

trans-unit.source: Diagram for Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Diagram for Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Run a Hive job using DocumentDB and HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Run a Hive job using DocumentDB and HDInsight

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] All variables indicated by < > must be filled in using your configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] All variables indicated by < > must be filled in using your configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: Set the following variables in your PowerShell Script pane.
trans-unit.target: Set the following variables in your PowerShell Script pane.

trans-unit.source: Let's begin constructing your query string.
trans-unit.target: Let's begin constructing your query string.

trans-unit.source: We'll write a Hive query that takes all documents' system generated timestamps (_ts) and unique ids (_rid) from a DocumentDB collection, tallies all documents by the minute, and then stores the results back into a new DocumentDB collection.
trans-unit.target: We'll write a Hive query that takes all documents' system generated timestamps (_ts) and unique ids (_rid) from a DocumentDB collection, tallies all documents by the minute, and then stores the results back into a new DocumentDB collection.

trans-unit.source: First, let's create a Hive table from our DocumentDB collection.
trans-unit.target: First, let's create a Hive table from our DocumentDB collection.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code snippet to the PowerShell Script pane after the code snippet from #1.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code snippet to the PowerShell Script pane after the code snippet from #1.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you include the optional DocumentDB.query parameter to trim our documents to just _ts and _rid.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you include the optional DocumentDB.query parameter to trim our documents to just _ts and _rid.

trans-unit.source: Naming DocumentDB.inputCollections was not a mistake.
trans-unit.target: Naming DocumentDB.inputCollections was not a mistake.

trans-unit.source: Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an input:
trans-unit.target: Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an input:

trans-unit.source: '*DocumentDB.inputCollections*' = '*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 1\>*,*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 2\>*'
trans-unit.target: '*DocumentDB.inputCollections*' = '*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 1\>*,*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 2\>*'

trans-unit.source: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.
trans-unit.target: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.

trans-unit.source: Next, let's create a Hive table for the output collection.
trans-unit.target: Next, let's create a Hive table for the output collection.

trans-unit.source: The output document properties will be the month, day, hour, minute, and the total number of occurrences.
trans-unit.target: The output document properties will be the month, day, hour, minute, and the total number of occurrences.

trans-unit.source: Yet again, naming DocumentDB.outputCollections was not a mistake.
trans-unit.target: Yet again, naming DocumentDB.outputCollections was not a mistake.

trans-unit.source: Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an output:
trans-unit.target: Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an output:

trans-unit.source: '*DocumentDB.outputCollections*' = '*\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 1\>*,*\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 2\>*'
trans-unit.target: '*DocumentDB.outputCollections*' = '*\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 1\>*,*\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 2\>*'

trans-unit.source: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.
trans-unit.target: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.

trans-unit.source: Documents will be distributed round-robin across multiple collections.
trans-unit.target: Documents will be distributed round-robin across multiple collections.

trans-unit.source: A batch of documents will be stored in one collection, then a second batch of documents will be stored in the next collection, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: A batch of documents will be stored in one collection, then a second batch of documents will be stored in the next collection, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Finally, let's tally the documents by month, day, hour, and minute and insert the results back into the output Hive table.
trans-unit.target: Finally, let's tally the documents by month, day, hour, and minute and insert the results back into the output Hive table.

trans-unit.source: Add the following script snippet to create a Hive job definition from the previous query.
trans-unit.target: Add the following script snippet to create a Hive job definition from the previous query.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the -File switch to specify a HiveQL script file on HDFS.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the -File switch to specify a HiveQL script file on HDFS.

trans-unit.source: Add the following snippet to save the start time and submit the Hive job.
trans-unit.target: Add the following snippet to save the start time and submit the Hive job.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to wait for the Hive job to complete.
trans-unit.target: Add the following to wait for the Hive job to complete.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to print the standard output and the start and end times.
trans-unit.target: Add the following to print the standard output and the start and end times.

trans-unit.source: **Run** your new script!
trans-unit.target: **Run** your new script!

trans-unit.source: **Click** the green execute button.
trans-unit.target: **Click** the green execute button.

trans-unit.source: Check the results.
trans-unit.target: Check the results.

trans-unit.source: Sign into the [Azure Preview portal][azure-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign into the [Azure Preview portal][azure-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click Browse on the left-side panel.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse on the left-side panel.

trans-unit.source: Click everything at the top-right of the browse panel.
trans-unit.target: Click everything at the top-right of the browse panel.

trans-unit.source: Find and click DocumentDB Accounts.
trans-unit.target: Find and click DocumentDB Accounts.

trans-unit.source: Next, find your DocumentDB Account, then DocumentDB Database and your DocumentDB Collection associated with the output collection specified in your Hive query.
trans-unit.target: Next, find your DocumentDB Account, then DocumentDB Database and your DocumentDB Collection associated with the output collection specified in your Hive query.

trans-unit.source: Finally, click Document Explorer underneath Developer Tools.
trans-unit.target: Finally, click Document Explorer underneath Developer Tools.

trans-unit.source: You will see the results of your Hive query.
trans-unit.target: You will see the results of your Hive query.

trans-unit.source: Hive query results
trans-unit.target: Hive query results

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Run a Pig job using DocumentDB and HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Run a Pig job using DocumentDB and HDInsight

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] All variables indicated by < > must be filled in using your configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] All variables indicated by < > must be filled in using your configuration settings.

trans-unit.target: Set the following variables in your PowerShell Script pane.

trans-unit.source: Let's begin constructing your query string.
trans-unit.target: Let's begin constructing your query string.

trans-unit.source: We'll write a Pig query that takes all documents' system generated timestamps (_ts) and unique ids (_rid) from a DocumentDB collection, tallies all documents by the minute, and then stores the results back into a new DocumentDB collection.
trans-unit.target: We'll write a Pig query that takes all documents' system generated timestamps (_ts) and unique ids (_rid) from a DocumentDB collection, tallies all documents by the minute, and then stores the results back into a new DocumentDB collection.

trans-unit.source: First, load documents from DocumentDB into HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: First, load documents from DocumentDB into HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code snippet to the PowerShell Script pane after the code snippet from #1.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code snippet to the PowerShell Script pane after the code snippet from #1.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to add a DocumentDB query to the optional DocumentDB query parameter to trim our documents to just _ts and _rid.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to add a DocumentDB query to the optional DocumentDB query parameter to trim our documents to just _ts and _rid.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an input:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an input:

trans-unit.source: '*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 1\>*,*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 2\>*'
trans-unit.target: '*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 1\>*,*\<DocumentDB Input Collection Name 2\>*'

trans-unit.source: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.
trans-unit.target: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.

trans-unit.source: Documents will be distributed round-robin across multiple collections.
trans-unit.target: Documents will be distributed round-robin across multiple collections.

trans-unit.source: A batch of documents will be stored in one collection, then a second batch of documents will be stored in the next collection, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: A batch of documents will be stored in one collection, then a second batch of documents will be stored in the next collection, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Next, let's tally the documents by the month, day, hour, minute, and the total number of occurrences.
trans-unit.target: Next, let's tally the documents by the month, day, hour, minute, and the total number of occurrences.

trans-unit.source: Finally, let's store the results into our new output collection.
trans-unit.target: Finally, let's store the results into our new output collection.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an output:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Yes, we allow adding multiple collections as an output:

trans-unit.source: '\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 1\>,\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 2\>'
trans-unit.target: '\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 1\>,\<DocumentDB Output Collection Name 2\>'

trans-unit.source: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.
trans-unit.target: The collection names are separated without spaces, using only a single comma.

trans-unit.source: Documents will be distributed round-robin across the multiple collections.
trans-unit.target: Documents will be distributed round-robin across the multiple collections.

trans-unit.source: A batch of documents will be stored in one collection, then a second batch of documents will be stored in the next collection, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: A batch of documents will be stored in one collection, then a second batch of documents will be stored in the next collection, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Run a MapReduce job using DocumentDB and HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Run a MapReduce job using DocumentDB and HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Set the following variables in your PowerShell Script pane.
trans-unit.target: Set the following variables in your PowerShell Script pane.

trans-unit.source: We'll execute a MapReduce job that tallies the number of occurrences for each Document property from your DocumentDB collection.
trans-unit.target: We'll execute a MapReduce job that tallies the number of occurrences for each Document property from your DocumentDB collection.

trans-unit.source: Add this script snippet **after** the snippet above.
trans-unit.target: Add this script snippet **after** the snippet above.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] TallyProperties-v01.jar comes with the custom installation of the DocumentDB Hadoop Connector.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] TallyProperties-v01.jar comes with the custom installation of the DocumentDB Hadoop Connector.

trans-unit.source: Add the following command to submit the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: Add the following command to submit the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the MapReduce job definition, you also provide the HDInsight cluster name where you want to run the MapReduce job, and the credentials.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the MapReduce job definition, you also provide the HDInsight cluster name where you want to run the MapReduce job, and the credentials.

trans-unit.source: The Start-AzureHDInsightJob is an asynchronized call.
trans-unit.target: The Start-AzureHDInsightJob is an asynchronized call.

trans-unit.source: To check the completion of the job, use the *Wait-AzureHDInsightJob* cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To check the completion of the job, use the *Wait-AzureHDInsightJob* cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Add the following command to check any errors with running the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: Add the following command to check any errors with running the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.target: **Run** your new script!

trans-unit.target: **Click** the green execute button.

trans-unit.target: Check the results.

trans-unit.target: Click Browse on the left-side panel.

trans-unit.target: Click everything at the top-right of the browse panel.

trans-unit.source: Find and click DocumentDB Accounts.
trans-unit.target: Find and click DocumentDB Accounts.

trans-unit.source: Next, find your DocumentDB Account, then DocumentDB Database and your DocumentDB Collection associated with the output collection specified in your MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: Next, find your DocumentDB Account, then DocumentDB Database and your DocumentDB Collection associated with the output collection specified in your MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Finally, click Document Explorer underneath Developer Tools.
